snippet: The creation of the team of outside advisers stands in marked contrast to General Motors’ early approach to handling the recall crisis, when it looked primarily inward to set strategy.
abstract: General Motors confirms that it has added crisis management expert Jeff Eller to team of outside advisers, marking a departure from early strategy of using internal talent to handle recall debacle; Eller is known as a canny behind-the-scenes player who managed response to Firestone tire recall in 2000.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and HILARY STOUT
byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic reported from Detroit and Hilary Stout from New York. Kitty Bennett contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The creation of the team of outside advisers stands in marked contrast to General Motors’ early approach to handling the recall crisis, when it looked primarily inward to set strategy.

headline.main: G.M. Turns to Experienced Crisis Experts
headline.print_headline: G.M. Turns to a Recall Crisis Expert
